Kree'arra is one of Armadyl's most trusted generals. He is the most powerful of the surviving aviantese, and leader to the forces of Armadyl's Eyrie in the God Wars Dungeon.

In order to reach the encampment, players must first wield any crossbow along with a mithril grapple. A Ranged level of at least 70 is then required to navigate the chasm. To enter the boss room, players must have slain 40 followers of Armadyl, with aviantese and their spiritual variants being his only followers within the dungeon.

Kree'arra can be seen yelling several battle cries in his chamber. However, unlike the other generals, his taunts are non-verbal.

Location[edit | edit source]

Location Levels Members Spawns Map
God Wars Dungeon (Armadyl boss room)5801Maplink

Fight overview[edit | edit source]

Main article: Kree'arra/Strategies

Like other God Wars Dungeon bosses, Kree'arra roams around a rectangular room with his bodyguards until a player enters, attacking them on sight. He attacks primarily with Ranged, and his bodyguards use a different combat style each. However, if no one is targeting Kree'arra, he will fly up to players to use Melee attacks as well. If all players leave, his health and stats will be reset.

Like other Armadylean followers, he and his bodyguards cannot be attacked with Melee.

Bodyguards[edit | edit source]

  • Flight Kilisa (Melee)
  • Wingman Skree (Magic)
  • Flockleader Geerin (Ranged)
A group of players fighting Kree'arra and his bodyguards.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 29,637 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Kree'arra kill, including its unique drops, is worth 264,047. Excluding the unique drops, the average kill is worth 10,966. Furthermore killing the three minions yields an additional 23,223 on average (including uniques), bringing the total to 287,270 per kill.

Rare drop table[edit | edit source]

There is an 8/127 chance of rolling the God Wars Dungeon-variant rare drop table and a 2/127 chance of rolling the God Wars Dungeon-variant gem drop table.[1] This table differs from the regular rare drop table and gem drop table in a few ways. This table is unaffected by the Ring of wealth.[2] The Runite bar drop is replaced by a Rune sword. The quantity range of some items differs. All empty rolls (1/2.70) are replaced by a coin drop of 19,500-20,000; however the chance of rolling these coins is included in the monster's main drop table and is not displayed here for the sake of clarity.

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve Kree'arra.

Name Description Difficulty Category
Kree'arra Adept Kill Kree'arra 50 times. Hard Kill count
Airborne Showdown Finish off Kree'arra whilst all of his bodyguards are dead. Hard Mechanical
Kree'arra Veteran Kill Kree'arra 100 times. Elite Kill count
Collateral Damage Kill Kree'arra in a privately rented instance without ever attacking him directly. Master Mechanical
Swoop No More Kill Kree'arra in a privately rented instance without taking any melee damage from the boss or his bodyguards. Master Perfection
The Worst Ranged Weapon Kill Kree'arra by only dealing damage to him with a salamander. Grandmaster Restriction
Feather Hunter Kill Kree'arra 30 times in a privately rented instance without leaving the room. Grandmaster Stamina

Dialogue[edit | edit source]

This article on an NPC has an associated dialogue page.
Click here for a transcript of possible conversations with this NPC.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Kree'arra had a festive override wearing a purple partyhat during the 2016 Christmas event.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
13 January 2021
(update)

Ironmen now have their own shared instance for each God Wars Dungeon general. The "Peek" option on doors will now tell players how many players are in the ironman instance.

25 June 2015
(update | poll)

Added a 'peek' option to the entrance of this boss, allowing players to see the number of other players currently in the boss room.

17 July 2014
(update | poll)

Players can now receive a pet version of this boss after defeating it.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 23 September 2015. (Archived from the original on 26 Mar 2019.) Mod Ash: "2/127 to go to gems OR 8/127 to go to RDT, from where 20/128 goes to gems. On gems, 3/128 for the talisman."
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 1 Feb 2019. (Archived from the original on 27 Mar 2019.) Mod Ash: "The GWD has its own version of the RDT, one that doesn't respond to rings of wealth as far as I remember."

[[File:Kree'arra chathead.png|left]]
'''Kree'arra''' is one of [[Armadyl]]'s most trusted generals. He is the most powerful of the surviving [[aviantese]], and leader to the forces of [[Armadyl's Eyrie]] in the [[God Wars Dungeon]].

In order to reach the encampment, players must first wield any [[crossbow (weapon)|crossbow]] along with a [[mithril grapple]]. A [[Ranged]] level of at least 70 is then required to navigate the chasm. To enter the boss room, players must have slain 40 followers of Armadyl, with aviantese and their spiritual variants being his only followers within the dungeon.

Kree'arra can be seen yelling several battle cries in his chamber. However, unlike the other generals, his taunts are non-verbal.

==Fight overview==
{{Main|Kree'arra/Strategies}}
Like other [[God Wars Dungeon]] [[bosses]], Kree'arra roams around a rectangular room with his bodyguards until a player enters, attacking them on sight. He attacks primarily with [[Ranged]], and his bodyguards use a different combat style each. However, if no one is targeting Kree'arra, he will fly up to players to use [[Melee]] attacks as well. If all players leave, his health and stats will be reset.

Like other Armadylean followers, he and his bodyguards cannot be attacked with Melee.

===Bodyguards===
*[[Flight Kilisa]] ([[Melee]])
*[[Wingman Skree]] ([[Magic]])
*[[Flockleader Geerin]] ([[Ranged]])

[[File:Fighting Kree'arra.png|thumb|250px|A group of players fighting Kree'arra and his bodyguards.]]

The average Kree'arra kill, including its unique drops, is worth {{Coins|floor({{#var:onekreeLoot}}+{{#var:kreeUnique}})}}. Excluding the unique drops, the average kill is worth {{Coins|floor({{#var:onekreeLoot}})}}. Furthermore killing the three minions yields an additional {{Coins|floor(3*{{#var:onekreeminionLoot}})}} on average (including uniques), bringing the total to {{Coins|floor({{#var:onekreeLoot}}+{{#var:kreeUnique}}+3*{{#var:onekreeminionLoot}})}} per kill.

==Trivia==

==Changes==
{{Subject changes header}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 13 January 2021
|update = God Wars Instancing and Soul Wars Improvements
|change = Ironmen now have their own shared instance for each God Wars Dungeon general. The "Peek" option on doors will now tell players how many players are in the ironman instance.
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 25 June 2015
|update = Boss Room Counters & Platinum Tokens
|poll = Old School Content Poll 34: XP droplets & Slayer
|change = Added a 'peek' option to the entrance of this boss, allowing players to see the number of other players currently in the boss room. 
}}
{{Subject changes
|date = 17 July 2014
|update = Boss Pets and Spawn Rates
|poll = Old School feature poll - Content Poll 22
|change = Players can now receive a pet version of this boss after defeating it.
}}
{{Subject changes footer}}
